UNDER CONSTRUCTION

Here's a thought: whenever we face difficulties in life, put up an UNDER CONSTRUCTION sign where we can see it. This is to remind ourselvesâ€¦

MITIGATE THE RISKS Google defines 'Risk Mitigation' as, "the process of reducing the impact of potential risks by developing a plan to manage, eliminate, or limit setbacks". Life is already full of risks that we cannot possibly always anticipate. That is why we need to have some sort of plan in place to help us to mitigate whatever risks that come our way. If you still don't have a comprehensive life and health insurance coverage for yourself and for those you love, then you're really just playing dice with life's risks. Connect with me and let's talk. I can help you become prepared.

"These companies allegedly promised guaranteed returns of 12 percent to 18 percent on investments, classified as interest income." --- One of the most basic rules of investing: if it's too good to be true, then it's probably a scam! So don't just look at the promised return on investment, look at the company behind that promise. Get 8% returns on your investment and the highest insurance rate GUARANTEED by one of the oldest and most trusted insurance company in the world--AXA. Message me to get more information. #AXAPhilippines #AXASecureFuture

5 foot 2 inches tall Demetrius "Mighty Mouse" Johnson who weighs 135 pounds recently got a win over a 250 pound, six foot tall opponent in an open weight BJJ tournament. He was obviously outmatched in size and weight. But what he lacked he more than made up for in terms of determination and years of actual experience, competing at the very highest level of the sport. In the same way, even if we have spiritual enemies around us with powerful influence and abilities, we have the assurance of victory over all these opponents. But we still need to learn how to fight by equipping ourselves with the knowledge of spiritual warfare that can only be acquired by reading our Bible daily and getting to know Jesus through prayer and meditating on his promises.
